channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: The New Apple Watch Ultra 3 Is $100 Off
item.description: You could save big on Apple's most recently released and most powerful wrist hardware.

item.title: Uber quietly pilots in-app video recording for drivers in India
item.description: Uber's in-app video recording pilot is currently live in 10 cities across India.

item.title: The best phone to buy right now
item.description: Editor’s note: Black Friday doesn’t officially take place until Friday, November 28th; however, if you want to shop ahead of time, we’ve rounded up the best early Black Friday deals you can already get. Haven’t you heard? Phones are boring now. And that’s just fine! Most people buying a new phone just want something familiar that works better […]

item.title: Les astronomes pensaient connaître les Pléiades : une étude révèle qu’elles sont 20 fois plus grandes qu’on ne l’imaginait !
item.description: Les Pléiades fascinent Homo sapiens depuis l'Antiquité sur la voûte céleste et encore plus depuis que les télescopes en fournissent des photographies en couleur. Mais cet amas d'étoiles n'a pas encore livré tous ses secrets, comme le prouve une découverte récente.

item.title: 6 Stephen King Movies We’d Love to See Remade
item.description: Edgar Wright's 'Running Man' is now in theaters, so are there other King movies that could use a remake?

item.title: The last-gen Apple Watch Series 10 has returned to its lowest price to date
item.description: The Apple Watch Series 11 is only a few months old, so discounts have been hard to come by thus far. However, if you don’t need the latest tech, the Apple Watch Series 10 delivers nearly the same experience, and the 42mm base model is currently down to an all-time low of $279 ($120 off) […]

item.title: Where have all the TV cameras gone?
item.description: This is Lowpass by Janko Roettgers, a newsletter on the ever-evolving intersection of tech and entertainment, syndicated just for The Verge subscribers once a week. Earlier this month, the UK's Comcast-owned pay TV operator Sky announced plans to pull the plug on one of its more ambitious hardware initiatives: Sky Live, a smart camera accessory […]

item.title: Netflix is turning its biggest shows into daily puzzle games
item.description: Netflix is getting into the daily puzzle games trend in a big new way. As part of a bunch of games announcements, the company revealed it would be releasing a new daily puzzle games app called Netflix Puzzled that will feature a bunch of puzzles themed around Netflix’s biggest franchises. “Get ready for a plethora […]

item.title: Netflix’s new era of TV games starts now
item.description: Netflix's next stab at gaming is here. Starting today you'll be able to play a number of multiplayer party games on your TV using your phone as a controller. To start, Netflix is offering Boggle Party, Party Crasher: Fool Your Friends, Lego Party, Pictionary: Game Night, and Tetris Time Warp. A social deduction game based […]

item.title: Newsletter platform beehiiv adds AI website building, creator tools in major expansion
item.description: Newsletter platform beehiiv announced a massive expansion to its platform on Thursday, including offering real-time analytics and AI website creation.

item.title: People With Long Covid Have This Freaky-Looking Thing in Their Blood
item.description: The finding could help scientists better identify and potentially treat these complex cases.

item.title: After 5 months, the $1,200 bottles of Besties All-In tequila are finally starting to ship
item.description: Orders were supposed to be fulfilled by end of summer but were delayed again and again due to the bottle.

item.title: Watch Blue Origin Launch NASA’s Mission to Mars in the Middle of a Geomagnetic Storm
item.description: The launch window opens at 2:57 p.m. ET today, and you can catch the action live right here.

item.title: Poker Face shocker: Could Peter Dinklage replace Natasha Lyonne?
item.description: Peacock has closed the door on "Poker Face" Season 3, but Rian Johnson has other plans — ones that involve recasting lead Charlie Cale.

item.title: Test du Amazon Fire TV Stick 4K Select : Vega OS, streaming 4K et nouveau souffle pour le stick d’Amazon
item.description: Disponible depuis quelques semaines, le nouveau stick HDMI 4K d’Amazon est taillé pour le streaming et les usages quotidiens voulant proposer une expérience remaniée à prix abordable. En voici notre test.

item.title: Red alert: Amazon just dropped a new record-low price on the M5 MacBook Pro ahead of Black Friday
item.description: Who needs Black Friday? The Apple MacBook Pro, 14-inch (M5, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD) is on sale at Amazon for $1,480, down from the normal price of $1,599.

item.title: NASA’s 230-Foot Antenna Damaged, Further Straining Deep Space Communications
item.description: The aging infrastructure of the Deep Space Network is operating at capacity and in desperate need of an upgrade. The latest news isn't helping.

item.title: Thousands of fake packages flood npm registry in major attack - here's what we know
item.description: The campaign could be in preparation for a malicious attack, or it could be a way to earn crypto tokens.

item.title: ‘Poker Face’ Is Dead, but Rian Johnson Has a Wild Plan to Revive It
item.description: Peacock is letting the show go, but it could come back at another outlet with Peter Dinklage replacing Natasha Lyonne.

item.title: Professor Scott Galloway perfectly explains the danger of treating AI like your friend
item.description: He says AI lacks the most important aspect of any relationship, calling the dynamic ‘empty calories.’ AI can do a lot of things. It can write your emails. It can make your grocery list. It can even interview you for a job.

item.title: OpenAI violated copyright law, German court rules
item.description: A German court has ruled against OpenAI in a landmark copyright case.

item.title: Uber, Lyft face lawsuits from male drivers, claiming discrimination
item.description: Male drivers are seeking damages from the ride share apps after the two companies announce features to only connect riders with non-male drivers.

item.description: Here's our quick guide on how to watch Moldova vs Italy for free as Gli Azzurri look to keep pace with Norway at the top of Group I.

item.title: Pakistan restarts VPN licensing in fresh bid to control online space
item.description: The Pakistan Telecommunication Authority (PTA) has authorized five companies to offer "lawful" VPN services, raising fresh concerns about user privacy and internet freedom in the country.

item.title: In defense of Apple’s $230 iPhone sock
item.description: From the same label that made the iconic Steve Jobs mockneck, the iPhone Pocket could be the next Labubu... if you have the disposable income.

item.title: Stewart Rhodes Relaunched the Oath Keepers. Even Old Oath Keepers Don’t Care
item.description: Militia leader Stewart Rhodes, who was convicted for his role in the January 6 attack, is asking potential new members and supporters to send money. Former allies are unconvinced.

item.title: Amazon retire 35 % à cet excellent moniteur Alienware incurvé QD-OLED (240 Hz, Dolby Vision, 0,03 ms) lors du pré-Black Friday
item.description: Voici un écran QD-OLED pensé pour celles et ceux qui veulent jouer comme si la réalité n’était qu’un mode graphique. Et pour le pré-Black Friday, le Dell AW3225QF fait un pas en avant coté tarif, il s'affiche à 725,98 euros au lieu de 1 119 euros sur Amazon.

item.title: Apple halves commissions for mini app makers
item.description: Apple introduces a new program for app developers offering a reduced 15% commission on qualifying mini app transactions.

item.title: Rosetta Stone Is Basically Paying You to Learn 25 Languages for Life Thanks to an Early Black Friday Offer
item.description: You will have lifetime access to a variety of languages, from Persian to Hindi, German, Korean, and more.

item.title: Disney stock tumbles as TV business slides further toward collapse
item.description: Lower advertising, shrinking viewership, and a $40M hit from political ads weighed on domestic networks despite sports posting modest gains. Disney reported $22.46 billion in revenue for the quarter, which just missed analyst expectations and resulted in a 5% drop in premarket trading on Thursday.
